channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

Usual dumping place.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish and health hazard, 5th August
item.description:
This rubbish is always accumulated in the garden area of 52 Beckenham Lane. It is right by the bus stop where children and their parents await the buses to and from school so the detritus apart from looking completely unsightly is also dangerous in terms of bacteria and the attraction of foxes and other wildlife Including rats. The property is rented so accordingly I have contacted the agent and sent similar photographs to her asking if the owner of the property could make other arrangements for the rubbish or provide a decent Baharier, for example offence or a war that obscured the filthy accumulation of rubbish by his tenants. I have a list of emails and have contacted them politely and informatively a number of times I can provide these emails to you if you so wish. Apart from the unsightly health hazards it’s not fair that us as neighbours have to walk past this property as we come from our cars. The resident parking is in Shortland Gardens and so it is necessary for me to access my house at number 48 to pass by this horrible site. I would appreciate it if Bromley Council would write to the owner of the property and ask them to take the action to obscure this filth from the road if indeed not require their tenants to desist from creating it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple sacks of rubbish near to 17 Haldane Road., 5th August

item.title: Builders materials/someones rubbish, 5th August
item.description:
56 Beatrice Road and the rest of there rest of the residents of Beatrice Road, I’m am sick of keeping asking them to leave their rubbish in their own bins instead of keep dumping them in our small bins for rats and foxes to drag out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Strathnairn Street, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Pickford lane, 5th August
item.description:
Pot hole appearing in the middle of Pickford lane, cars avoiding it causing driver frustration. Also the painted lines and zebra crossing are so faded. Why is there a yellow lid placed over a drain on the pavement outside bungalow 49 Pickford lane? It’s been there for four months . Been reported to council. Any updates?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flat mushrooms growing at the base of young tree, 5th August
item.description:

item.title: Litter on Tabard street, 5th August
item.description:
There is broken glass, plastic bottles, paper and food packaging on pavement and road on both sides of Tabard Street. Despite Fixmystreet saying this has been cleared, the rubbish is still on the pavement and the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 217, Tabard Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public Tree/Bush - Fruit on Pavement by Bus Stop, 5th August
item.description:
The pavement by the bus stop is covered in fruits, causing mess, a slippery risk and bad odour. It would be appreciated if the bushes were pruned and the pavement cleaned. Many thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southlands Grove, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes past the weeks notice, 5th August
item.description:
Please can these be removed! This is the second 1 week deadline that has been missed! These bikes have been there as long as I’ve lived here, 3 years.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
